message.body: Hey Lindsey, how does this crit thing work??

Ugh. So whatever faculty thy can scrounge together come and sit and give feedback. I am going only for my editing students this year. You can come for as little or as much as you want but I think they expect us to atleast come to some.
Ah. Are the vid production kids getting crits?
Sometimes it's fun cause they gossip about students
Nope. No freshman. If any are sophomores they will
Cool. I like gossip. I'll try to go for 1/2 a day or something...
Yeah it's more fun when you don't have students screening cause you kinda feel bad for them as they get reemed by Pete
I bet Pete is a real reemer... And is Wendy the marshmallow she seems to be, or is she rough too?
Actually she's pretty funny and mean too around Pete. She's all like, "I don't get what you are doing. At all."
John gives great feedback and Byron too. More constructive
Well that'll be fun then. Are the full timers there the while time? Ugh for them.
Full timers are there all week all the time. So they like to get some different opinions especially with juniors and seniors
Jeez, I'd hate to screen like late afternoon on the Thursday.
Cool. Imna try to show up when you're there. More fun that way!
And they get lunch if there are a lot of us
Oh man it's the worst. Everyone's so mad
YESSSS! It will be hilarious. I have no idea what my students are going to turn in
They have to edit chase scenes
And they are all soooo behind
Ooh that's fun. I wanna take your edit class!! We should talk actually. Where do you get your ftg?
I have them shoot some stuff then I have footage from Alison's editing class of monk and a nature doc
I want a short film tho
Ps I should take your editing class.
Cause you are a real life editor

Yeah a short film would be awesome. Something with multiple scenes and beg-mid-end structure. And also something else that they can be creative with in a less continuity-style way. And sometimes I think that editing all the time doesn't actually help my teaching of editing all that much.

Yeah maybe we can find a good short film to cut for structure and share it. I also like the non continuity because that's what I actually do. We do an intellectual montage with found footage that's always cool but that's about it.
Everything else is continuity.
